ygData.msgSnippet: That packages.html file is definitely out of date; it seems to be mostly describing the 1.X architecture and class packages. In H3, lots has been moved around,

That packages.html file is definitely out of date; it seems to be mostly 
describing the 1.X architecture and class packages.

In H3, lots has been moved around, there is no CandidateURI, and 
CrawlURI happens to be in...

[heritrix3]/modules/src/main/java/org/archive/modules/CrawlURI.java

...but in general I suggest using your OS or IDE file-finding facilities 
to find the exact location for files/classes you suspect exist but may 
be deeply/unintuitively nested.

Classes supporting the web UI are in:

[heritrix3]/engine/src/main/java/org/archive/crawler/restlet/

If you're working from the git HEAD, supporting Freemarker templates are at:

[heritrix3]/engine/src/main/resources/org/archive/crawler/restlet

- Gordon

On 5/23/13 12:35 PM, stjiggyfly wrote:
> Hello All,
>
> I am looking through the source code for Heritrix 3.1 along with its
> documentation and I've run across a few files that I don't seem to
> have anywhere. In "packages.html" inside the main package where
> Heritrix.java is located it talks about a couple things like "admin"
> which should be located at: {@link org.archive.crawler.admin
> org.archive.crawler.admin}, which is nowhere to be found, as well as
> the datamodel which is located at:{@link
> org.archive.crawler.datamodel org.archive.crawler.datamodel}. I have
> the datamodel package, but it only contains one java file for
> UriUniqFilter.java, when the documentation says it is also supposed
> to contain files such as CandidateURI and CrawlURI, which are both
> essential. The crawler works, so assume they are at least somewhere.
> Is this just bad documentation? Or are some of these files gone?
>
> On a different note, I would also like to find the files for the Web
> UI itself. I assume they are JSP files or Servlets. Could someone
> point me to what package, or folder they might be located in?
>
> Thanks! Keith
>
